title: Keira Knightley finally confirms baby daughter's name two months after giving birth
text:

Hollywood megastar Keira Knightley has confirmed the name of her newborn daughter two months after giving birth.

The Pride and Prejudice actress, 34, welcomed baby Delilah with her husband James Righton.

Delilah's got a big sister in the couple's first child, the adorable 4 year-old Edie.

Keira announced the name in a candid interview with The Daily Telegraph , where she also said that she had planned to take six months' maternity leave.

She's had to make exceptions, though, including the premiere of her film Official Secrets earlier in October.

The star also told of the difficulties of breastfeeding while still being tied down by certain work commitments.

(Image: WireImage)

She's had to prep and pump little Delilah's feeds so she can be fed while mum works.

Keira said of the interview that it meant she'd had to prepare "three whole feeds."

"We're going to be apart for six hours in total," she said, "So I pumped three feeds' worth."

She continued: "If I don't do it my boobs will explode. I mean, quite literally. It's going everywhere. So, you know, that's not happening. The pump is with me. It's fine."

(Image: Corbis via Getty Images)

(Image: Getty Images for Chanel)

Previously, the mum of two was widely praised for her openness about the mental health impacts of motherhood.

Chatting with The Guardian , she explained: "Your body just created life and now it's shifting in order to feed it.

"That's monumental and we're all expected to go, 'Oh no, all good, I'm groovy - I haven't slept, I'm fine.'"

(Image: REX)

Delilah's also making the couple think twice about getting involved in environmental activism with the controversial Extinction Rebellion.

Keira dished: "We keep having this discussion where we're saying to each other, 'Should we get arrested?' And I'm like, 'We can't, we've got a baby, she's permanently attached to my boob. So how's it going to work?'

"So then he's going, 'Maybe I'll go down and get arrested for both of us,' and I'm like, 'Let's neither of us get arrested now. It's not the right time.'

"I think a lot of us just want to find a reason not to think about it."
description: Keira opened up about the difficulties of breastfeeding her newborn with her busy schedule despite being on maternity leave
